description: Keto friendly! Ordered the bacon cheeseburger with avocado and of course no bun. A bit cheaper than going to melt burger.
author: Andy D.

description:
Manhattan hub has a plethora of choices between sandwiches, salads, soups, and fries. The food is of standard quality and is decent, but nothing out of the ordinary. I usually have the Philly cheesesteak sandwich with a side of fries- yum!

They have some indoor seats for you to enjoy the food. I usually sit at the tables outside in the alleyway where they are located. 

The price is typical for downtown San Francisco.
author: Simon S.

description:
I was on my way to another restaurant when I saw a sign for their fish and chips and made a detour. I love me some fish and chips! I walked in around 11 am before the lunch rush.  There was a woman restocking supplies at the register who'd seen me walk-in, and we look at each other; she says nothing.  Maybe it is not in her job description to greet customers because that is when the manager walks out of the kitchen area and says hello.  

Although I came for the fish and chips, I studied the menu- they seem to be somewhat of a deli. A cheesesteak shop and burger joint rolled into one. Much variety of food items to choose from. They have shakes, too, which is always a plus, but I didn't get one due to an already heavy meal. It is a very tidy, sleek and modern establishment with plentiful seating and even more seating in a closed off area just outside the building.  It was a beautiful day out and decided to eat indoors because I'm always cold!

The food took a while, which was understandable because it was barely lunchtime and they probably needed time to warm up their fryers.  The fish was nice and crispy on the outside and light and flaky inside, though I doubt is prepared in-house; it is not the kind you would get at a fish fry.  I didn't care too much about the fries because they're the kind you buy that are pre-salted, which is also salty for my taste.  Tarter sauce was a single packet  Kraft brand, which is unfortunate because I love to give my fried fish a good dipping.  At least they didn't forget the lemon, so all basis were covered.

Overall, I had an a-ok dining experience but doubt I would be back anytime soon.  Perhaps if you were bringing a picky and unadventurous friend out to lunch, this might be the place to go.
author: Leslie G.

description:
I was going somewhere else for lunch and saw the crowd.  What the heck, I will give it a try and order Prosciutto and Brie panini.  I was given a number and told to wait at the end of the counter, among the crowd all thumbing their cell phone.

The lady came and called numbers and the person will walk up to grab the bag.  I did so in about 15 minutes.  The panini was warm and wrapped in foil and there was a pickle in the bag too.

The meat and cheese melted dripping delicious.  The panini was grilled just right, a bit crunch but not too chewy.

This is now on my list of go-to lunch place.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description: I eat here frequently, bring friends, colleagues, even business guests when we want something tasty, filling and served fast. Their pricing is similar to other casual lunch choices in the Financial District...try the deli salads!
author: David K.

description:
Decent place to get a quick lunch. Just a block away from where I work I can usually get my order in less than 15 minutes even when there's a rush so 5/5 starts for convenience.

They have an extensive menu ranging from sandwiches, soup, med, and cold pasta dishes.

Food: I honestly come for the french fries. LOL. They're steak cut so they go with basically anything on the menu. 

- Fish and Chips - nice alternative when you're trying to switch things up from the normal routine of sandwiches or salads. The fish is nice and fresh and crisped to perfection. The batter is a little thick in my opinion which is my only issue. They even give you malted vinegar when you take it to go!

- Gyro - As a fan of med food I was so excited to see that they had this on the menu. The meat was tasty and it was filling. However, I thought the sauce was bland and I prefer to have pita or a thicker bread to have it wrapped in.
author: Keizzel C.

description: I come here occasionally when I'm craving their burger buns I get the veggie burger which is pretty good for a veggie burger but I keep coming back for those soft buns... about 15 bucks for a burger fries drink and tip isn't bad in SF I've always left with a full stomach.. I've gotten the philly cheese steak sandwich when I used to eat meat and it was ok not enough cheese and the meat was dry. They have a wide variety of items including a lamb burger which I've heard is pretty good.
author: Miguel C.

description: Some of my coworkers come here for fish and chips and I decided to give it a try the other day.  A far cry from the soup, salad and sandwich spots that the FiDi is laden with and let me tell you, Manhattan Hub is doing it right.  The fish and chips here are reasonably priced for the area (around $12 for an order that could have fed two) and the fish was SO GOOD.  The malty beer flavor was prevalent in both the fish and in the batter - delicious.  Speaking of batter, it was paper-thin, light and crispy. The food was so good that I went up to the counter after eating and told the staff how much I liked it.  The only thing I'd change is that it would be nice to be able to get a half order.  The restaurant is clean and well-stocked with any condiment you'd like.  I hate it when places cheap out on things like lemon wedges or sauces.  Not this place - it's all out for you to take as much as you'd like. I'll be back soon!
author: Emma H.

description:
Online ordering definitely helps. This place often has a lot of people. I don't like long waits so thank goodness. By the time I walked there, my food was ready :)

Staff were nice and helpful. Food looked and smelled delicious. I had the Philly Tender Steak and Cheese and FRINGS, total $11.69!! Frings were nicely fried. Philly was pretty good too. Not the best IMO because it doesn't make me want to die for more. Only thing I disliked about the whole order was how oily everything was!! I know I know... it's suppose to be but it was dripping out of the box!
author: Benita M.

description:
For some subsconscious reason, I was excited by the name of this place. Manhattan sounded so cosmopolitan and uptown, but it turned out to be more Hoboken than Manhattan and more spoke than hub. Like the kind that broke off your banana-seat Stingray when you taped baseball cards to them to make your bike make that flatulence noise. But then the name Hoboken Spoke would sound like a school that gives elocution lessons rather than a deli which it's trying to be. And speaking of flatulence, I was not a fan of this place. It's in a choice spot in that alley off Sacramento across from Wayfare Tavern attracts a lot of FiDi regulars during the busy lunch hour. It was also hot the day I went with the sun blinding me since I forgot my sunglasses. That also contributed to my dissatisfaction, I suppose.

There was quite a queue waiting to order, and believe me, someone didn't take a shower. And it wasn't me. Some of these tech guys need to live with girls who could tell them they smell bad before they leave the house into a world of innocent noses. Anyway, I was in the mood for a veggie sandwich, so I ordered the $7 Garden Hub, which sounded pretty good with avocado, greens, provolone, tomato, sprouts, cucumber and a sun-dried tomato spread on foccacia (photo: http://bit.ly/1Bf3pNy). That sandwich refused to come together for me. There was a cakiness to the spread that I found unappetizing that I threw it in the trash after three bites. It was redeemed by the $3 Couscous Salad which I liked even though it tasted like it was in the refrigerated section all morning. There's outdoor seating which I suppose could have been nice if I brought my sunglasses. Manhattan Hub? No. Hoboken Spoke. Yes it did.

FOOD - 2 stars...mediocre veggie sammies...an those ain't hard to put together
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...not quite Manhattan...and there is the smelly tech guy, too
SERVICE - 2 stars...felt like cattle
TOTAL - 2 stars...this ain't no deli for my belly, fo'shizzle
author: Ed U.

description: I had their Philly cheesesteak yesterday for lunch and been sick with food poisoning since. Definitely not going back. I should have been cautious of a small place that try to sell 6 different cuisines. God knows what kind of expired meat or cheese they shoved into that sandwich. The city should inspect these places.
author: Baha Y.

description: Awful! Awful!, Awful! I just got back after waiting 22 minutes for veggie patty melt. I figured the veggie patty is already cooked so it shouldn't take as long to prepare. Boy was I wrong. I watched other orders placed after mine come out so I think they have an issue with kitchen organization. For a restaurant to survive in SF, you can't have that. On top of all that, the used the wrong bread.  This place is fine if you want salads or a cold sandwich but be prepared to wait and be disappointed if you order anything from the grill.
author: Chip H.

description:
Downtown is full of sandwich joints the way New York is filled with blue and white memorabilia.

Here they have ho-hum chili and a ho-hum sandwich.

Give me a real New York sandwich over this joint any day.

Fast service though. But with all the competition I won't be coming back.
author: Jack R.

description:
I've stopped in a few times since my last commentary.

On a whim I tried the fish and chips, knowing that the fish is frozen (and a brand, Trident,  one can get at Costco), but it was pretty darn good -- came out hot and crispy and the fries were right too.  I was quite pleased.

More recently had the Mediterranean Plate (salad) -- it was very good, and as I remember it from years ago.  Best yet -- the falafels came out fresh from the fryer -- and it makes a world of difference.  When they are made and then refrigerated (other places) they are ok, but sort of chewy and stale.
author: Larry C.

description: I think 80% of my office likes this place and the other 20% is indifferent. The food is fine. They have decent sized portions and offer sandwiches, wraps, Mediterranean food and salads. Their salads are good and there are a number of nice selections from the basic Caesar to the Chinese Chicken Salad and Greek Salad. They have both hot and cold deli, specialty and grilled sandwiches where you choose your own type of cheese and toppings. I recently decided to try the  Mediterranean Plate Salad with tabboleh (made with quinoa), hummus, falafel, dulmas with pita and it was great. I usually get a salad here but wanted to try something new and I was pleased. Everyone else orders a sandwich and there are no complaints.
author: Jen L.

description: Nice spot with outdoor and indoor seating, both of which are kept clean. The menu is extensive but salted generously. That being said, this is my favorite new lunch spot. French dip is bomb, probably try corned beef next time
author: Garrett N.

description:
Got a falafel wrap here.  The falafel is cold.  The outside is oily and the inside is dry and crumbly.  I guess they make them and let them sit for hours before using them.  Overall, just very mediocre. I watched them make sandwiches for others as I waited for my wrap.  It looked a lot like what you'd get at Lee's Deli.  (Not a plug for Lee's...just an indicator of the quality you're getting.)   I won't come back.

The rating for this place seems inappropriately high given how empty it was, and how mediocre the food was.  This hasn't led me to down-grade my own rating...it just seems suspicious.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch fix. Ordered a half soup and half salad for $8+ which is pretty decent for lunch in the Financial district.

I ordered the chicken noodle soup and the prosciutto pasta salad. Both were delicious although portions were a little small.

They have great outdoor sitting so if you're here with a large party, this could be a good place to chill outside on a day with great weather. Service is fast and they are well prepped to deal with lunch hour crowd, although it didnt seem to be very crowded when we went...
author: Christina N.

description:
My co worker introduced this place to me first by bringing me a delicious Philly cheese steak with bacon and avocado. A week later I had to come myself to check out the menu and the restaurant. They have many options but of course I had to get the avocado and bacon again. I was a little disappointed because my fries were cold and a little under cooked. My sandwich was good though and I requested ranch dressing which made it even more delicious. I would definitely come back and try something different here. 
The line tends to get long during lunch but it moves pretty fast.
author: Irma R.

description: Food is good. Sylania is rude. I called to check that my fax order was received as I tried 20min earlier but the phone line was busy. I asked if she received it and she said 'really it's busy right now' then hung up. Then I had to call back did the order go through? Then I got the information I needed. I get it you're busy it's lunch time but I'm just trying to do my job too.
author: Crystal M.

description: Love this place! It's right by my office so I stop in for lunch about once a week or so. The wraps are really really good and the tomato basil bisque is unbeatable! They don't have it every day, though. A large variety of delicious pre made salad, too (fruit, quinoa, chicken)! Highly recommended.
author: Clay P.

description: Pastrami sandwich was overpriced and super dry. No condiments at all
author: Ryan D.

description:
I experienced the worst service at the Manhattan Pub today and my company will not be going back there ever!

I ordered a Cobb & Avocado Salad and Mushroom Cheese Steak & Fries.  When my assistant went to pick it up the blue cheese salad dressing was missing. So I went back to get it and I was told it was in the bag, then I was told it was in the salad.  I stated no it wasn't if it had been I wouldn't be back. (argumentative couldn't get there story straight)

 I then asked if they could add a cup of soup to my order which would be $2.50 and the answer was no because my salad was already purchased and I would have to pay the $4.50 for a side cup of soup without an order.  I stated the only reason I came back was because of their negligence.  Still argumentative

While I was waiting for them to put their HORRIBLE sweet blue cheese salad dressing in a container,  the customer behind me, had requested his salad for here and they gave him a to go container.  When he asked for a plate, he received an argument as well as the cashier stated he requested to go.

One of the worst things a business can do is be rude to a customer/business  especially with all of the other restuarants, eaters, deli's and such in the FIDI to go to.
author: Lisa S.

description:
So I found a Go Dish deal here for the bacon avocado Philly cheese steak.

The restaurant is in an alley way and when you walk in; it felt like I was in the deli department in a grocery store. 

So the deal was 40% on a sandwich and fries combo. The fries were really good and the sandwich was the perfect amount for a lunch. It doesn't include a drink, however, there's always water. 

Plenty of seats if you come after 1:15pm. I will be coming back here to try another sandwich. However, I felt a bit thirsty after eating my sandwich..
author: Adam J.

description:
Like many delis, Manhattan Hub gives out punch-cards to frequent customers: if you buy 10 sandwiches, your 11th is free. So I have been dutifully going to MH once a week for many months to collect my punches. Sure, they are insufferably crowded at lunchtime, but it's never been longer than a 10-minute wait, and the variety of their fabulous menu is worth it and their sandwiches are delicious.

On Tuesday, August 19, I went in for my 8th card punch. I ordered a tuna melt to go, paid for it, and was handed a to-go placard with #24. I stood directly next to the cash register and waited, and waited, and waited. My wait seemed unusually long. Nearly 20 minutes passed. At NO time did anyone working there seem fazed by how long I was standing there or bother to check on my order.

Finally, after realizing that food orders were being handed to customers who had arrived long after me, and seeing that there were NO tuna melts being prepared on the grill, I asked where my sandwich was. The manager lethargically picked up a soggy, abandoned box of food with #23 written on it, that had been sitting on the counter DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF ME FOR 20 MINUTES and said, "It's right here. The girl wrote the wrong number on it" and then he WALKED AWAY. NO apology. NO offer to re-heat my sandwich and fries, which were limp and cold. NO offer to make the mistake right - no voucher for a new sandwich, not even an extra punch on my card or any other compensation for my inconvenience. Absolutely nothing. The jerk just handed me an old sandwich that was as stone-cold as his rudeness, and walked away.

It was bad enough that the counter girl got my order number wrong, and the equally incompetent staff couldn't figure out that the unclaimed sandwich belonged to the customer standing next to the counter for 20 MINUTES. But the manager's rudeness sealed the experience: I paid $10 and 20 lunchtime minutes for a nasty, greasy, COLD tuna melt and fries, with an extra side of bad attitude.

I understand that no one is perfect and that mistakes happen. It is how businesses HANDLE their screw-ups that make all the difference. In this case, that difference  means you've now lost a long-time customer who has worked around the corner for years. Good-bye.

Unfortunately, now I have a worthless "frequent customer" card with 8 punches on it. Anyone want it?
author: Christine D.

description:
I think this place has become one of my favorite spots for lunch in the FiDi.  

It's fast.

Casual.

Food's great.

Service is always impeccable.  

I always have such a hard time deciding what I want.  

I know it's not a 'legit' Philly Cheesesteak (no they do not use cheese whiz), but their cheesesteaks are pretty delicious.  

Can't go wrong with their fish&chips either.  But be warned, it is fresh out of the fryer and super hot.  Bite slowly!  

Or, if you're feeling healthy, they have a great 3-item salad too.  Their quinoa salad is so flavorful and delicious!  One of my favorites!

There's outdoor seating, but it's usually cold.. come on, it's San Francisco.  We probably get 10 'hot' days here a year.

All in all, I really like the variety.  Solid place for lunch.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
Coworker: "What do you want for lunch today?"
Me: "I want to stress eat something. Preferably something greasy and fattening with french fries."

And that's how we found Manhattan Hub. 

There wasn't much of a line to order, but the food did take quite a while to come out. They do have a deli case of ready-to-go stuff so if you don't want to wait that might be a better option.

My fish and chips came with vinegar and tartar sauce and was a large portion. So I didn't feel like I was being ripped off for the price, because it was a little expensive. But it was good and more importantly, filled my need for fried and unhealthy food.

They have a big menu so I will likely go back to try something else. Maybe something less fattening next time.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Unbelievable.  A simple grilled cheese went from 3.99 (reasonable) to 7.50. And fries that aren't that great are 5.50...OMG! No thank you. Not again

For some reason this is showing under Manhattan Hub...this is not correct it should be Bistro Burger!
author: Shirley B.

description: Convenient place for a good cheesesteak at a normal price. It was fairly busy but not too busy here, which is nice balance if you need a quick place to stop for lunch and aren't expecting anything gourmet. French fries were average.
author: Philip L.

description:
I know it's San Francisco and cheap lunch isn't easy to come by, but $8 for a nicely sized gyro wrap is pretty hard to beat. That is, until I realized that this is a bare-minimum kind of wrap. Not bad, but not repeat customer worthy either.
My customer service experience was just fine but after reading other reviews, I assume it is rather hit and miss.
Manhattan Hub is a decent restaurant, but I'll likely pass in the future.
author: Jacob S.

description:
Ok let me just make this clear to avoid this place and their dumbass workers. Came here to redeem a go dish offer and I didn't know how the process was but I figured the dumbass women workers would have a clue but they didn't. Paid for my order but it was funny that I didn't get a number with my order which is what I saw was the norm here. Waited for 15 minutes before I asked someone that worked here where's my order. Got word that even though I paid for my order that since I didn't place the order that my food wasn't made or in the processed of being made. 

It shows the ineptness of this staff of all women that I was waiting for 15 minutes and no one asked me anything. Customer service here is poor at best and this is what happens when you hire people who can barely speak and/or understand English. I guess this is what happens when you deal with minimum wage workers... You get minimum wage service.
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
Nice lunch place with outdoor seating.  Great Philly sandwiches (I go for the chicken Philly).

Wish they'd open one in SoMa so I could go regularly.
author: Paul M.

description:
I have ordered from Manhattan Hub several times. Each time thinking that they will get it right this next time. I buy for 100 people each time and "Habet" seeming irritated that I'm calling. The orders never seem to come quite as complete as how the catering site says. Missing the side salads or not enough for the order size and me having to call every time to get the remaining items that we had ordered.
 
The Pickles are the only thing people asked me about at the office, which are from Sysco foods BTW....

Please correct me if I'm wrong, but when a customer comes to your establishment several times buying for 100 people or more each time....you might be at least a little hospitable..You might even remember them...."maybe"?  I called today after 3:30PM so it wasn't during a rush and asked about the pickles they serve with the sandwiches and  told him why I was calling and how the office was raging about them and he said:  
 "I  really don't care what you want the Pickles for", but gave me the name anyways. 
  Maybe it's a culture thing so I may give him the benefit of the doubt but I will not be making a "Habet" (From Hebrew name Iafet which means "nice" or "persuader") of ordering from there in the future.

Was not customer service oriented and certainly only tried to persuade me NOT to come back.

SO-SO
author: Justin M.

description:
Ordering online is so easy! I work a couple blocks away and by the time I order and pay online they have my sandwich and drink ready to go by the time I walk in! 

Try the prosciutto sandwich. With fresh mozzarella and tomato (and request a balsamic drizzle), you'll have a terrific lunch! They were so generous with the prosciutto that I took a little bit off - shocking, right!
author: Melissa R.

description:
Came here for the Arugula de Parma salad. The proscuitto parma was about the only part I liked. I ordered it and it was already pre-packaged and ready... nothing screams NOT FRESH like something that's already been made, even if they made it 5 minutes ago.

The dressing was not only extremely thick to the point that it wouldn't pour, just kind of plopped onto the salad, but it did not go well with the proscuitto parma. The red cabbage is way too bitter for a salad with not a lot of sweet.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Came here with coworkers for a quick bite to eat. I had the falafel wrap with hummus. The falafels were not dry, but they could have had a bit more flavor. The hummus that accompanied the wrap was not good-too watery in texture and seriously lacked flavor. 

I probably won't come here on my own, but it is a suitable lunch spot for a quick bite to eat with coworkers as they have a wide selection of different types of food.
author: Kerina J.

description: There was a worm in my salad. Nothing else needs to be said. Don't go here. Too many other good places in SF.
author: Amanda P.

description: Long time since I've been here and some work folks suggested it.  Thought the cheesesteak was pretty good.  Though it didn't look that big, filled me up nicely with no drink or fries.  I would have liked an option for cheese choice, but the whiz-like substance was tasty.  Only negative was kind of greasy liquid at the bottom from the grease and cheese sauce.  Good assortment of peppers and onions.  Price reasonable, $8.16.  Quick handling of the lunch rush.
author: Marc S.

description:
I stumbled upon this spot trying to find the closest Post office from my work. I came around 2:15pm, so the lunch rush was gone. Apparently this place is packed, and has become a very popular FiDi spot to eat at. You've probably seen it before if you work around. It is the place that has metal chairs and tables in an alley. You can still dine inside.

As for the food, they had a wide variety of choices from salads to veggie sandwiches to even Philly sandwiches.

I chose the "Philly Tender Chicken and Cheese" meal, which came with a side of french fries and a soft drink for $10.45. They hand you a plastic number and bring the food to your table. 

The sandwich was great! The cheese, chicken, and jalapenos were well-balanced. Definitely nothing bad to say about the joint. Good location, and not very costly. I think they even serve beer. I will definitely come eat here again!
author: Chris E.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for what it is: a convenient place to get your lunch if you work in the FiDi. I go here a lot and I'm never let down. Their 3 salad deal is great and the portions are huge. The sandwiches are also great. The line goes quick but sometimes it can take a bit to get a to go order during the lunch rush.

Keep it up guys.
author: Nick K.

description:
This is yet another generous three star review.  I ended up at Manhattan Hub against my better judgment.  I was heading towards farmerbrown's little skillet (hoping to finally check off a spot I've had in my bookmarks for months) and realized that there was a Giants 12:45 day game and, hence, it was probably not the best idea to try a place near the ballpark, so I wandered aimlessly looking to a decent substitute.  Ever had a craving and not get it, like a craving for a pizza and you settled for a burger instead, so you ended up getting physically full but not mentally satisfied? 

Hindsight, of course, is 20/20.  I would have preferred a slightly longer wait to the nearly catastrophic fish and chips I was given at Manhattan Hub.  The fries were soggy, lifeless and just plain bland.  The three strips of lightly battered fried halibut were okay, but not memorable.  The problem is that the fish was not very tender and flaky, and was quite hard.  Overall, not a very satisfying lunch by any means.

The place, in terms of selection and quality, is similar to a deli one would typically find in Raley's or Safeway - lots of selection, very few of them are actually very memorable, but they are at least filling.  Like I said, this is a very generous three star rating.
author: Angel S.

description: Walked down the alley from my work to try this place while I had limited time and the wait for my order wasn't very long but I'd have to say it was only OK in taste. I ordered chicken soup with a grilled cheese and I felt both were lacking and kind of bland. The sandwich didn't hold up its figure too long from my 1 1/2 block walk back to my office, it was flat by the time I got there, maybe it sweated too long in the box, I don't know. For the price and wait,  I guess I would say it was OK.
author: Maribel C.

description: Very disappointing 1/2 sandwich, 1/2 salad. Sandwich was tasteless and chewy (not in a good way). Salad portion was tiny, and involved mystery meat apparently. For a dollar less I could've had a giant and delicious Cafe Venue salad a block away. That'll teach me for going outside my regular rotation :)
author: Sarah R.

description:
Breakfast Burrito review:

very expensive for such a small burrito.  Terrible size to cost value.  Took an above average amount of time to make.  No extra salsa included, salsa inside was good.  Bacon was crumbled, almost like bacon bits.  Better places in financial district for breakfast burritos (gods food).
author: Mike I.

description:
Manhattan Hub offers a little bit of everything... 
breakfast, assorted hot and cold sandwiches, and various salads. If you can't decide on one salad, they offer a three for $8.99 deal. 

It's nothing to rave about, but the prices match the quality which is decent.I got the chicken parmiagana sandwich, but I should have gotten the chicken and bacon sandwich based on the reviews. i wouldn't mind going back to try it.

They have some outdoor tables for when the weather allows. I also noticed signage about how they prefer cash, but will take cards if they have to. Way to make me self-conscious about using my Visa!
author: Mariela D.

description:
I have been to the place two times, just to make sure it was not just a fluke the first time.
I ordered chicken shawarma salad and asked for it to be mixed with the dressing, it was delivered to me on the side instead, I asked them to please mix it for me so the nice lady took it back and drizzled the dressing on the top of my salad.

It really didn't matter because I could not eat any of the chicken, the cook must have rolled it in salt and no other seasonings.  My friend who tried it said it was more salty than the sardines she had last week.  Pretty bad for salad.

I paid $10 to make myself sick, not going back there for the 3rd time for sure.
author: Lena T.

description: This review is solely about the crab cake sandwich. It was my cheat day and it was heaven on a bun. Carbs and fried crab cake with a side of fried french fries (which were also delicious) DO IT
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
Great place for lunch in the Fidi. Casual and fast service. Order counter style and they give you a # and deliver food when ready.  I love their Fish and Chips. So hot and crispy and just yummy! 
Outside seating is a plus! Located in an alley so may be hard to locate off main streets.
author: Lauren W.

description: Great wraps and salads!  One of the more reasonably priced restaurants for lunch in the Fidi. Plus the staff is super nice!!
author: Katherine E.

description:
3 1/2 stars. 

Quick lunch place that serves sandwiches, wraps, pasta, fish and chips....not bad at all, but it's not super yummy either.
author: Karen H.

description:
Came here for lunch a few times. Had their salad and soup combo twice.

Today I tried the Fish and Chips. 
The fish was properly battered, not too thick, with a descent helping of fries (chips) in the basket.
I did get 3 pieces of standard sized fish and the fries were just a tad soggy.
Not bad for 11 bucks, though certainly not a inexpensive lunch (but hey, I did get fish and chips and I did eat at the FiDi so meh...)

Will definitely come here again though!
author: Jonathan W.

description: This used to be one of my favorite lunch places, but after what seemed like a big jump in prices, I can't justify going here very often anymore. I'll get the 3 salad lunch because it's fast, but that's it.
author: Greg M.

description:
Fair French dip - the roast beef wasn't great but the bread and jus were ok. It came with a hearty (ha!) pile of good, thick cut fries for $8.50. I was using a coupon which helped a lot. You can serve your own fountain drink or take the complimentary water and lemon slice. Staff were as quick and friendly as could be expected during a busy lunch rush.

The dining room has a nice feel with murals adorning crimson walls, though tables were a bit tightly packed. Be aware that there are MANY different signs for daily specials scattered around, so good luck spotting them all AND reading the main menu board before it's your turn to order.
author: Bill B.

description:
My cousin introduced me to Manhattan Hub 10 years ago when I started working with him in the FiDi. This place is still good after all these years. 

The Hub Philly- Meat, mushrooms, green peppers, grilled onions and pepper jack cheese. Excellent. Filling and worth it.

Chicken and Pesto panini- Not quite a grab and go, but it is fast. Not currently on the menu, but it should be. Its become one of my new favorites. 

3 salad plate- Choose 3 different types of salad for a whopping $8.90 Not worth it in my opinion. I'd get just about anything else from here but this.

Service is friendly and fast.
author: Heather P.

description:
I really like the 3 salad option.  Their Chicken louie salad is super yummy.  The Jamaican jerk salad, pasta salad are pretty good too.  Pricy for what you get but sometimes you just want variety. Comes with a bread roll.

Their chicken parm sandwich is pretty good
The crab cake sandwich is aight
Their chicken tenders and fries are ok too.

They have an large menu and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.

They have a frequent customer card too so if you go a lot, be sure to ask for one.
author: C A.

description:
Dear Manhattan Hub,

Thanks for the online ordering system!  +1
However, no thanks for having a confusing system where there's only one line for ordering and paying, which led us to not know where to pick up our already-ordered food.  We ended up standing in the single line with everyone else.  A clear, designated "ONLINE ORDER PICKUP" spot would be much appreciated.

Thanks for your wide variety of food.  Sandwiches, wraps, salads, and more are nice to see on a day where I can't make up my mind.  +1
However, no thanks for your beef gyro wrap.  Though there was plenty of beef, the tahini sauce was all dried out on the meat (how long had it been sitting there?!), and the "lavash wrap" was a really small, hard, dried pita pocket.

Thanks for your reasonable prices, especially in the Financial District. +1
However, no thanks for my overall experience here.  I came here because of my Scoutmob 50% off, but I won't go running back into your arms anytime soon.

2.5 stars, rounded up to 3 with their outdoor seating, which was pretty much empty due to yesterday's chilly temperatures and strong gusts of wind.


Yours truly,

A not-so-satisfied CCG
author: Tori S.

description:
(See pics)

Over and over again I eat here. From Philly cheese steak, to the Mediterranean salad ($7.95), to the signature illy coffee and they also carry the whole beans that you can brew at home, to the most important fact that they are open until around 4pm! Perfect for busy people when it comes to Fidi food places.
author: T L.

description: A lot of choices on the menu. Service was good and food was quick. Cheesesteak I had was delicious. Perfect for lunch or a mid-workday pick-me-up. Would definitely return again. Glad I randomly decided to stop in.
author: Taylor D.

description:
This place is okay. If you want a sandwich, great sandwiches here.

Otherwise, avoid. I had a salad here once where the lettuce tasted pretty funky. Wasn't pleased, especially with salad options around. 

Furthermore, I've had an omelette here. Pretty run of the mill -- very little ham. Not many other options, either -- usually omelettes have lots of filling but none of them suggested as such.

They should focus on what they're good at and remove a lot of their options. That way they can focus on what they're good at -- sandwiches.
author: Patrick F.

description: Got there 20 min before close. Gps had hard time with correct spot. Got the pulled pork sand. Excellent. Great ambiance. Great menu. I will be back
author: M P.

description:
My bf and I have been on a quest to try Mixt Greens.

The only problem is that both of us always get lost along the way,

or I get sidetracked,

and we end up going somwhere completely different.

Manhattan Hub was a recent pleasant detour on our quest to Mixt Greens.

Manhattan Hub's menu is extensive and they have this great "try our three gourmet salads" option for around 7 dollars.

Their gourmet salads, a combination of pasta and leafy green mixes, (pre-prepared and showcased in a glass showcase) all looked drool worthy.  I was also particularly taken, and regret not trying Manhattan's middle eastern fare which was wedged among the gourmet salads, and which may or may not be included in the "gourmet salad"  deal. (please excuse this very boring sentence)

I ended up ordering the Chinese Chicken salad. The salad was about half the size of a basketball and I was impressed with the large quantity of sprinkled toasted almonds,and mandarins inside it. However despite it's large size, I was unimpressed by the lackluster mango dressing and dry chicken on top of the greens.

My bf ordered the cheese steak and fries. Cheese oozed out of the bun, leaving him wishing he'd ordered something healthier. But the perfectly crisped fries and sandwich were finished quickly.

Though Manhattan Hub is a little bit of a hike from the office, it seems to be a quality lunch option, with some limited outdoor seating too.  

It can best be compared to standard reality TV. Worth watching at least once, though no project runway.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I'm reviewing only for what I get here---which is usually the Rueben sandwich.

It's a huge sandwich with a whole pickle and a side of cole slaw for under $8 (before taxes)!  The beef (choice of pastrami or corned beef) is delicious and flavorful (tons of it) is on marble rye.  Sauerkraut is one of my favorite parts of this sandwich.  The only thing I don't get on this sandwich that they do is, I substitute their Thousand Island dressing with regular yellow mustard.  

Service = deli-style, so quick fast-in-and-out.  They do have an on-line site where you can place orders, so that's real convenient for quick lunches.

Odd note: They do not carry potato salad of any sort.  They carry tons of salads and fries (and very delicious crunchy onion rings) but not potato salad!! *shakes fists*
author: Fannie S.

description:
I feel like somewhat of a shill, giving so many 5-star ratings lately, but I just moved to a new area of the city and have had the greatest luck with finding new places.  I am finding these places by looking for coupons on LivingSocial.com's Instant Deals.

The Manhattan hub is a quasi-deli that is located in the center of the SF Financial District one block from the TransAmerica Pyramid.  It's located on a foot-traffic-only street that is lined with small tables for eating, and the angle of the street prevents the wind from taking over, and it gets good sunlight.  Double bonus.

Their menu is awesome IMHO based on my personal taste, but includes things like sandwiches, salads, wrap (Which I heard everyone talking about in there) and some like dishes.

I went out on a limb and got the Cajun Chicken Sandwich, which is a "Spicy Grilled Chicken Breast with pepper jack and house dressing on toasted kaizer roll."  IT... WAS... AWE-SOME!!!!!  I'm glad I tried something different from a menu that was chalk full of the traditional staples of my eating habits.

The place inside is very nice, which a lot of seating.  The service was quick, and the check-out guy was very nice and we chatted a bit about how LivingSocial was working out for them.  Really great experience in general.  I'll be back for sure.

If I wanted to casually ask a girl that I like out to lunch, this is where I would take her.  But I'm married, so that's not going to happen, but I'm just sayin' for the SFC bachelors out there just use this review as an excuse to ask that girl that you've been diggin' out to lunch.
author: Bradley H.

description:
Came here because of the livingsocial deal, and got a chicken gyro wrap. It was really bland and pretty small.  Definitely not worth even the $4.32 I spent (with the deal) on it.

This place might be better for their sandwiches, but I hate it when a restaurant has items on their menu that just suck in comparison to everything else. What's the point?
author: Richa A.

description: Another victory for the living social lunch special! I decided to try this place on a lark and a coupon and I'm very happy I did. There was a line but the wait wasn't long at all and all the salads behind the glass looked delicious! I'm making a mental note to try the salad trio with fresh bread next time I'm here since that seems to be the signature dish they serve but this time I went with the chicken with portabello sandwich with a side of garlic fries. The garlic fries were fresh and had just the right amount of garlic so as to not offend my co-workers. The sandwich was juicy and the bread was like biting into a cloud. The counter guy and the other staff were very courteous and friendly which actually surprised me since I personally would've been more stressed out  if I worked there considering how busy it was. Worth the extra long walk from my work to get there and I will definitely be making a repeat appearance.
author: Norris T.

description: Best Philly Cheesteak I have had outside of Philly - Here's a tip, don't go during the normal 12-1 rush and your Philly will taste fresher and better prepared.
author: Matt S.

description: I really was hesitant to try Manhattan Hub because, being from the East Coast, anything with the name "Manhattan" or "Philly" in it makes me nervous.  I'm always thinking it won't be anything like Manhattan or Philly food. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  The first time I went there I got the chicken parm sandwich.  It was excellent!  I returned again this past Friday and got the "Philly Chicken Cheesesteak" and it was fantastic!  Both times I ordered a side of fruit with my sandwich and it was the freshest fruit around.  Kudos to Manhattan Hub!  Quick service, great food, and a nice atmosphere outside to sit and enjoy it all.
author: Sandra P.

description:
A recent discovery, that I absolutely love!

The salad plate is delicious; I usually get the chicken apple, pasta jerk chicken, and then usually the caesar salad.  In the past, I've also gotten the chicken club and fish and chips.  All have been excellent, so I would definitely give this place a try if you're looking for quick and easy, but still delicious!

There's even a frequent customer program, gotta love that!
author: Vince S.

description:
I'm low-carbing it at the moment and was able to get a pretty decent piece of lean pork tenderloin over a good sized green salad with nothing but greens, cucumbers and tomatoes and the dressing on the side for $11 including tip... Overall the meal was exactly what I wanted, protein and greens, I asked for no carbs and they got it.  I am amazed at how often you ask for no rice or bread and they give it to you anyway, as if they like to waste food. 
The service was fast, the outdoor seating on a warm day was just right and I felt great about eating a tasty lunch and not undoing my 2 hours of exercise prior to lunch.
author: Nilu r.

description:
I've put this one on the regular lunch rotation because I love their many salad options; it's a dieter's delight. The outdoor patio on a sunny day is wonderful.

Get the Living Social Daily Deal via Instant Deals
author: Kiristen R.

description: This place is OK. Not really A-Ok as the three star reading claims to represent, but just regular OK. The food is fine, albeit a little expensive, the setting is fine,  the service is fine. The real point is, you can do better by walking a block or so in any direction. Unless, maybe, you really want a cheesesteak, since they seem to be the only place around that does something like that.
author: neil c.

description:
I circled in and around the 343 Sansome lobby like 2 times before the security guard finally asked me, "Do you need some help?". I sheepishly answered, "Yea, i'm looking for a sandwich shop". She finally directed me to Sacramento where Manhattan Hub is located. Working in Fidi, I've never actually heard of this place or come across it despite walking down Sacramento to work almost daily, I guess its easy to overlook. 

I basically came here to use my Scoutmob deal (50% off) and they have a ton of choices to choose from. I ended up getting the "Manhattan" Turkey Reuben sandwich with a side of small onion rings and a drink. The price was pretty pricey at almost $14 for everything (whew scoutmob). 

The sandwich was a decent size but it seemed like the quality of ingredients just weren't up to par with what they were charging. The rye didn't really have the rye taste you're looking for in a rueben and the turkey didn't seem like good quality deli meat (go to Algiers!). The onion rings were decent, although slightly overdone. It was nice that the sandwich came with coleslaw (pretty bland) and a whole dill pickle. 

All in all there is a ton of variety at this shop (including a lot of wraps and greek food) but they might be sacrificing variety for quality. I would only come back with another 50% off'er. 


the DL: entrance is on Sacramento, not the Sansome address listed.
author: Truman S.

description:
Great place for lunch!  

Yay, their fries are yummy and they have tabasco sauce on the tables.... BRING IT!  Awesome menu...GARLIC FRIES, FRINGS!!, wide-selection of wraps, salads, hot & cold sandwiches, & desserts :)  *nom nom nom...*

For the amount of food you get, it's reasonably priced for FiDi.  They also have those frequent user cards (adding on to my stack ...)  I had the tuna melt with fries (pickle on the side? *shrug) ... it wasn't the best I've had but it was super filling ... needed help finishing my fries.  

Fast and friendly service!  I'll be back.
author: Kat C.

description: Solid.  Good food and variety, and best fish n' chips in the area (halibut).  A little pricy, but worth it.
author: J S.

description: This place is one of my #1 go-to's for lunch in FiDi. There are many items to choose form that are all high quality on the menu at about the average cost of what something in the city would cost. I recommend the Chicken Shwarma or the Chicken Pesto Panini w/ fries!
author: Eric B.

description: Extremely slow for lunch. It took 15 minutes for a steak and cheese that had no cheese. I won't be back. I'm sure they don't care to keep my service as the wait staff was rude and short with me. Its not terrible, it didn't make me sick.
author: Justin S.

description: I just grabbed a quick lunch the other day while I was working around the hood.  The interior design is very colorful and they serve a wide variety of fresh food.  The price is just about right.  Definitely will go back to try the rest of their menu.
author: Steve L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday. Decent atmosphere, looks like a typical sandwich shop in an alley with some outdoor seating.

I had the 2x NY Steak burger sans the burger and fries, with bacon on the side. Even though I asked for it medium rare, it was really tough and I would not eat again. The bacon was cooked pretty poorly as well, it tasted like a more meaty, flat version of pork rinds.

Best part? The girl said I'd get charged $0.50 less per burger without the fries. I look, and I was actually charged extra. Awesome.

This place? Nothing to see here, move along now. (Might I suggest Bistro Burger which is right next door? Now there's a place I like!)
author: Ayumi Y.

description: Disappointing. My Philly cheese steak was pretty small and it tasted pretty bland.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I was in the area for training and was looking for a place to eat.  I found Manhattan Hub tucked away at a corner of the ally.  Ordered Chicken Parmesan sandwich, frings and a drink ($11+!?!?!).

Food came out fast.  Sandwich was pretty good.  Frings were a rip off.  I only got 3 onion rings and a small amount of fries (Mickey D's gives more).  

The place was packed so I had to sit on the counter and hop on one of those stools (very uncomfortable - once you hop on how do you scoot your chair back to the counter to eat?).

Food is good albeit pricey.  Not really a place I can go to every day (budget wise).
author: Wendy H.

description:
Good quick place for lunch that's not going to set you back much. I have come here a few times and have always left full and satisfied. Both times I have had the crab cake sandwich and chicken Cesar salad which I have shared with the Bf. 
What I like about this place is you get a lot of food and are full to the point of wanting to crawl under your desk for a nap, yes like George on Seinfeld. 
It's nothing special but there is a pretty big selection so everyone in your group is sure to find something that will satisfy their mid day hunger. You're in out and full.
author: Corynne O.

description:
Eat here. It is good......

No actually don't because I'd rather not wait in line behind you lol. 

These guys do a few things really well. I've eaten here many times, each and every time I go I am not disappointed. The Philly isn't classic, but tastes great. I've taken many friends here and they all have loved it. This place does classic, not so healthy food really well. And that is something I value. 

Keep on Keeping on guys.
author: Devan R.

description:
I only take the time to write a Yelp review when I am extremely impressed or extremely disappointed. This review falls into the latter. 

I just ordered the Philly Tender Steak and Cheese which arrived freezing cold and tastes absolutely disgusting! I'd rather skip lunch.
author: DivineAngel X.

description:
Sadly, I fell for a picture of beer battered fish and chip advertised on the window of this place. I ordered what I assumed would be one of their signature dishes substituting coleslaw for fries.

What they brought out were three very small pancake thin fish pieces that looked like they came straight out of the freezer. After trying one, I knew I have had better fishsticks from  Lucky's that not only had better fish, but better batter.

The coleslaw was beautiful looking and a large portion for the extra dollar it cost. The taste was so bland, I was glad to have malt vinegar and a lemon wedge to give it some flavor. 

The only consolation was the outdoor seating. I will not even bother to try to their other NYC deli specialties as I already know where to surely get high quality and authentic Manhattan food in SF. Terrible place, it will not last, unless they is a major reorg. Good riddance.
author: Scott G.

description: Their hummus is fantastic- pair it with their falafel wrap and you're in for a treat. They also have sandwiches that will seriously get you excited for lunch. There is outside seating so that makes lunch nice when we have sunny days.  The lunch rush is usually from 11:30-12:45- orders can take up 10 minutes so that kinda sucks but everyone that works there is moving fast and is super nice so I don't mind too much.
author: Angela C.

description:
This place sucks.  I work around the corner, so I popped in for some fish n' chips as advertised outside.  I got 2 pieces of small, stale, over-fried cardboard fish.  The picture outside shows 5 pieces of plump fish.  Not so.

It's also smelly inside, and kind of depressing.  A total rip off.  Go to Wexler's across the street for the same price and much better food, or anywhere in the Financial District for that matter.
author: COQUEDdotCOM C.

description:
Mmmm i saw the pork loin sandwich on the menu and I had to try it. Filling and still satisfying with a generous amount of fries (although I probably should'n't have had that! but it was just so good). 

I had enough for left overs the next day :)
author: Quinallison D.

description: The service here is awful and unbelievably rude.  We've tried them twice for team meetings for 10 -15-persons.  The orders were very incorrect both times.  Things missing, things that we didn't order, not enough of things, etc.  I also got push-back from the manager on the second occasion when I had to go back to get the complete order -- he told me I should have checked everything before leaving and that he would correct it "this time" but it's the customer's responsibility to check the order.  (Really?  I'm supposed to unpack and check 15 orders in an overcrowded deli?  That would seem to be their job.)  No apology.  Can't believe I was suckered into trying this place a second time, won't be back. Too bad, we kind of liked the food...
author: Roger S.

description: Found this a pretty fine place for lunch in the FiDi. Soups, salads and sandwiches all seemed fresh and portions hearty. Order at the counter and get a number. Outdoor seating in Leidsdorff Place is quiet and nice. Food is delivered quickly and prices are reasonable for the 'hood. Really enjoyed it.
author: Joanna S.

description:
This place has a rythym of an auto assembly line so be ready to order as the man behind the register doesn't offer much advice.  I had a sandwich, made to my specifics, and they use very fresh products, quite impressive actually.  Good selection of beverages, root beer was very attractive and cold.  Seating is a bit packed, but not too bad as they have a window bar with stools that increase the capacity.  It is SF after all.  They can accomodate larger groups as they have tables for 3-5 people.  

Give it a try....
author: Dave S.

description: The salads variety is delightful and  are the sandwiches are tasty. The ambiance is decent and the service is minimal but to the point. the hub appeals to the suits and ties in the area that don't have much time, so if you're in a bit of a hurry and still want a decent (or slightly more than decent) bite to eat, this is the place for you. The soups are pretty good as well.
author: Stephen G.

description: I've been checking this place out a lot since it first opened because it's next to Bistro Burger, a place I go once in a while when I'm at work and always wondered what they had to offer. On the last day of my work, I finally decided to come here for their highly advertised fish n chips and by god were they fresh, juicy, tender, and delicious! It was a tad pricey but it was so fresh and delicious, it totally made my day so I just forgot about it being expensive. I really recommend the fish and chips to everyone. I would love to try this place again or at least come back for their fish and chips if I ever get a chance to go back down town. But financial district foods are always pricey.
author: Judy C.

description: Best freakin' Reuben sandwiches. Great selection of salads, sandwiches, entrees, etc. Very reasonably priced for the financial district. The staff is also very friendly and courteous!
author: Kevin-louis B.

description: Came several times and had different experience. The first two times were really good, the sandwiches and fries came out hot and fresh. I ordered paramesan chickens and fries for both times. The chicken patty and the fries were crispy and hot. But on the third time, I ordered the paramesan chicken and fries and they were warm. The sandwich and fries  were soggy and not crispy like been sitting there for sometime. I ordered it in restaurant and picked it there and it was not like I called in or placed online where I came pick It up later.  The price is not too bad that I got the sandwich and fries for the price of a sandwich elsewhere in that location. I might come back but I will make sure that my food is hot when I order.
author: Anonymous B.

description:
Really great outdoor seating and a killer pulled pork sandwich. Definitely worth putting into rotation if you work in the FiDi or Jackson Square.

Also has a nice view of TransAmerica tower which is nice if you're eating with a client from out of town.
author: Ted T.

description:
Good if not memorable eats (grilled chicken teriyaki sandwich could have used more sauce and more veggies).

Speedy and efficient service (order placed and food delivered in about five minutes).

Reasonable prices (less than $6, which perhaps justifies the lack of sauce and veggies).
author: Jason B.

description:
i've only been here once, and this is based on that experience. i was in the mood for a fish sandwich, and decided to get the crab cake sandwich. it was alright, but i asked for no mayo and it had some gross sauce on it which was not indicated on the menu. i got it to go and had to try to wipe the sauce off.

also, i asked for a specific kind of dressing, and they gave me a different kind. they also put ham on a green salad. i do not eat pork, and detest ham, but beyond that, it doesn't belong on a basic green salad anyway.

i really wanted to try more of the stuff on their menu, but my first experience wasn't that great. i also think the sign that says "we prefer cash but take credit cards" is very weird. i told them i didn't have enough cash, and the person look at me like i was a moron and told me they take credit cards, but i just wanted to make sure it was ok with that passive-aggressive sign posted!
author: Kate W.

description:
Well-hidden cheesesteak secret?   Not to be.  It's well-hidden alright, but I'm gonna call it a well-hidden cheesesteak obscurity.  Steak was fairly bland, dry, and uninspired, rescued only by the white american cheese.  Strangely, although I waited a good 10 minutes while the food was ostensibly being cooked, both my cheesesteak and onion rings were decidedly lukewarm when they arrived.  I am open to suggestions as to how this is possible.  

I might try this place again for the salads because I do love me some mayonnaise.

Lots of fake tans here, on the boys even.  I'm not sure if this is a characteristic of this region of the FiDi or just my swell luck.
author: Jared L.

description:
How to make Manhattan Hub a 4-star experience in 7 easy steps:

1. Have a light breakfast. (This is important.)
2. Purchase the $4 for $7 LivingSocial lunch deal. (This is also important.)
3. Order a Philly Cheese Steak. 
4. Pass on the fries and don't even think about putting ketchup on there. (Optional, but recommended.)
5. Delight! 
6. Roll -- heavily, even painfully, but blissfully -- back to wherever you came from.
7. Rate Manhattan Hub 4 stars on Yelp with a satisfied grin.
author: G. J.

description:
I came to Manhattan Hub to get a little breakfast.The place is a decent size with more than enough tables to sit and enjoy. 

I browsed the breakfast menu.I had a few choices like: egg and cheese w/ english muffin,breakfast burrito,bagel w/cheese or the Manhattan Omelette. 

I decided on the Manhattan Omelette didn't care about the calories or the fat that came with that.I walked here and got my exercise on.I decided on the ham and got grilled potatoes and toast with the meal. 

Prices are decent and the meal overall was ok.Nothing sent me into a loud moan of excitement.I think they have a pretty good selection of lunch options:sandwiches,salads and desserts. 

Must try that out. 

Friendly service with a smile I got.
author: Dani D.

description:
YUM- YUM.. Today I tried the Crab Cake sandwich and was impressed it was soooo tasty.. it came with french Fries -which were a bit salty .. but that's okay the sandwich itself made up for it. 

I wish I didn't work so far from this spot otherwise I would be a regular and try the rest of their goods. They have a menu that has everything from breakfast sandwiches, reg. sandwiches, different salads and pastas, and even wraps! 

The overall spot was very clean and it was packed .... good things my friends and I ordered in advance and didn't wait more then 3 mins for our order! So I was happy with that... I say if you are ever in the heart of downtown SF and want to eat at a clean cafe spot I recommend this spot. The food is good and the prices are right!
author: Christina F.

description: Not bad. Fast. Casual. Easy.  Soup and sandwich was good. If you need a quick and tasty lunch, not pricey, this works.
author: Josh B.

description:
Manhattan Hub is definitely one of the usual spots I go to for lunch in the FiDi. It's fast and I like the variety of food they offer.  There's a little outdoor seating area in the alley, perfect on a warm afternoon.

When I feel like having salad, I pick their 3 items salad plate $8.95 now (used to be $7.95). Most of the salad items are tasty but heavy due to the dressings, but I like the avocado and tomato, chicken and pasta Caesar salad, and Chicken Apple salad.  

They also have fish and chip on their menu which is yummy. Cod or Halibut. 

They also serve hot and cold sandwiches, it's decent. But I would recommend the pull pork sandwich. Not sure if it's on the menu anymore though.
author: Christina W.

description:
Three words: Chicken Ceasar Wrap.  

Thanks to my Yelp Elite cousin, Juvily C., I was turned on to Manhattan Hub and their scrumptious chicken ceasar wraps. Now this place is a little farther from my work than I'd like, but it's worth the walk. I haven't tried anything elseon the menu, but i'm sure they are just as good. 

nomnomnom.
author: Joshua C.

description: What service, they LISTEN. I am thrilled with the outside service, great prices and a rewards card. This is a great little hidden spot. Lots of salad options, they are very quick and close by.
author: Natasha M.

description: Didn't even get the Manhattan connection with the name til I just remembered now (duh), as it really is like one of those countless delis you would find all over midtown NYC. Awesome selection- next time I wanna try the Gyro or Philly. The pastrami was OK, but clearly was the presliced kind you could just as easily get at Costco...
author: Jim B.

description:
[disclamer: stay tuned for my overdue entries later.. i'm at work, but who knows, if i get extremely bored, i'll update]

What a treat! i'm surprised that i even have an appetite considering the fact that i almost fell off the bridge. (more details about that later).

YUM.

sry, i wouldn't give it 5 stars because it wasn't totally outstanding, but it was faboulous... 4.5 to say the very least.

for you FiDi slaves in the house, this is inside the CAC // Mechanics Bank Building, just around the corner from the wildflower cafe..

they have daily specials, and have a wide variety from breakfast, deluxe sandwiches, low carb specials, philly steaks, wraps, veggie, grilled chicken, hot sandwiches, and soups. i haven't tried the others but i do know by the looks of it, it was quite fresh and tasty... the line moves fairly quickly... 

each table has tabasco sauce, ketchup, A1 sauce and a side of salt and pepper.  i also love how they have these sliced up lemons por mi agua in the back where the utensils, napkins and straws are...

i got me chicken tarragano (4 stars, nice size of chicken, diced up celery, YUM, but overall still good) prosucitto pasta (4 stars, they ain't cheap about their prosucitto!), and tomato & avocado (5 stars! yum, they don't dice up their avocados into cubes or nothing, it's actually nicely sliced, i love me tomatos and avocados! peek foto!) 

there's outside seating too for your conveinience. 

+1 SUPER CHEAP...  $7.25 (get the salad option! 3 gourmet salad w/a slice of a french baguette, yes! you can get it toasted too without having to pay like foccacia!)
+1 EXTREMELY FRESH INGREDIENTS! 
+1 extremely clean (they use gloves)
+1 extremely friendly and always willing to give you a sample..
.5 WIDE variety from salads and sandwiches

peek foto! 

WOW, but i have to say, i think i overdid my mayo limit for the month, but that's not MH's fault...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I have never been to Manhattan, but if this place resembles it in any way at all there must be an eclectic mix of food. Perhaps Manhattan is like San Francisco? I've heard people throw around "West Coast Manhattan" when talking about Suckah Free before.

This spot gives you many different choices; salads, wraps, soups, french dip sandwich & of course a cheese steak. In the spirit of adding to my beloved & artery stenosin' cheese steak list, I gave the Hub a chance.

On this particular day, the Cheese steak was actually on the list of daily specials--came with fries & a soda for something like $8. The fries were nice & crispy, a good portion of them as well. The sandwich itself was decent with the Hub's seasoning making it one of the more interesting & flavorful cheese steaks I've had in the city. The major drawback was the sandwich size--I finished my lunch & left feeling like I could have used about 5 more bites of unhealthiness.

I'll be back to try other items on their menu, but their cheese steak doesn't quite match up with the likes of other San Francisco spots.
author: matt m.

description:
This place is great to buy a salad.  My salads are always super heavy and I've yet to eat a salad less than $10.   Here, at Manhattan Hub, you can choose 3 different salads for $6.95 and the portions are huuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuge.    

Suggested selection combos: 

1) lentil and rice, tabouleh, roasted eggplants
2) spinach mozarella tomatoe salad, green bean salad, pesto salad

if i ate chicken, i'd get the chicken tarragon and curry chicken and if i ate ham, i'd get proscuitto pasta.   

Anyways if I weighed my plate on a scale, it would be $13 for sure.
author: Wakako U.

description: I came here for lunch with a co-worker and it wasn't bad. I had their crab cakes sandwich with garlic fries. You can tell the crab cakes were probably frozen but their garlic fries were pretty good. I could smell it on the way over to my table. Service was ok, lunch in the financial district is not the best time to expect great service in these quick places. But they have outdoor seating which will be great during the spring and summer time.
author: Linda L.

description:
This place is great for a quick bite in the FiDi. The food here is fairly inexpensive ($7 for a full basket of fries and a French Dip). 

The menu here is quite diverse and has many vegetarian and salad options as well as items for the total carnivore. The food here is good but not great but the atmosphere is lively and the prices are terrific. I recommend this place.

I also just found out that you can place your order online and have large orders delivered. Taking the time to offer extra services that add convenience to the customer really means a lot to me.
author: Nerd A.

description: First time here. Got a sandwich to go. Such a confusing system. Take an akward table top number thingy while you stand and wait for your order?  Excuse me, sorry, no i'm not in line. Wait, where do i stand? oh, I gotta tell the cashier what I ordered without a receipt first? Gotcha... Tons of people coming at you from all directions. A stressful place. Couldn't wait to get outta there. Good veggie sandwich though. And they even give u a whole pickle to go with. Whoot.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
If someone dangles the term "Ultimate Grilled Cheese Sandwich" in front of my face, I'm gonna fall for it.

And when I see the word "ultimate" before any meal name, I'm envisioning the angels singing, cheeks flushing and pants dropping.

This grilled cheese did not do any of the above to or for me.

It was OK. 

It's pretty hard to mess up a grilled cheese, but it's also pretty easy to spruce it up. This one lacked character for me.

It's wet outside and I needed a hug from cheese. Overall, it was pretty bland. And the bread a little rubbery, almost as if they microwaved my sandwich and then grilled it to save on time. Blasphemy I say!

Good prices, but I'm probably better off trying a deli sandwich or salad next time.
author: Jessica P.

description: They have coffee here! I wanted a salad for lunch and my friend wanted coffee so I was thinking we weren't going to find a place that had both. I don't drink coffee, so I never noticed if a place sold both coffee and salads, but apparently there is such a thing. So yay for this place. I got the spinach salad and it was huge. I didn't even finish the bacon and olives. They had cucumbers in the salad which I don't normally have with my spinach salads, but the cucumbers were fresh so it was good.
author: Jeanie F.

description:
Have you ever been on a date so boring it made you fall asleep?  Usually I would blame alcohol for not being "all" there.  After all I've never had the personality of a John Cage or an Ally McBeal.  

But there have been a few occasions where my mind has just d---r----i---f---t---t---e---d because the topics are so god damned boring like ("oh I'm an actress" ... [translation unemployed], just moved out here and did I mention Girls Next Door is my faaaaavvvoorrrite show???)  'No you didn't, and I'm sure if I cracked open your head I'd find a hamster running on a broken wheel'.  

Manhattan Hub certainly has the caliber of food to make eating boring.  Yeah it all looks good under the glass covering but so do fake tits.  Doesn't mean what you're getting is what you thought you were getting.  

The couple of times I've been here the Philly Steak has been disappointing.  I've eaten much better cheese steaks in my time and they weren't covered up with a bunch of salt and seasoning.   The salads have been drenched in dressing ... I think I heard the lettuce literally suffocating in there!  

I've seen some other comments about the fries here.  Ummmm are you reviewers on crack??  These things aren't that special here ... no different than frozen crap coming out of a bag and into the deep fryer.  Have someone cut some fresh potatoes in the back, throw them into the fryer and then MAYBE you have my attention.  

The pastrami sandwich was a big disappointment.  First I could've sworn these guys were using cured ham.  Now I'm know I'm not a food specialist but I'm sure the two are different.  The so called pastrami was VERY VERY salty.  (All the swallowers are rolling their eyes at this comment.)  That alone prompted me to up my water intake to two gallons that day.  

Overall, the food here is boring folks.  Nothing special.  Just like Girls Next Door, please change the channel.  Thank you!
author: Bill P.

description:
There are few things I love more than a good Reuben. Poking around downtown SF, I've only heard of a couple places that actually offer this scrumptious sandwich. Manhattan Hub was one of them. Keep in mind, I had no reason to venture to this place other than their Reuben, since there are many more sandwich places of higher caliber nearer where I work.

So it was with great anticipation that I ordered their Reuben. I figure, if they're keeping true to most places east of the Mississippi, I couldn't go wrong. I mean, the Reuben is just five ingredients. Shouldn't be too hard to not muss it up, no?

Who the heck puts mustard on a Reuben?! In the holy high canon of Reubens and their variants, I have never read of, seen, nor eaten one that had mustard on it. Strong deli mustard, at that! Now, this might have been a nice touch had it not overpowered the rest of the sandwich and drowned out the sour of the sauerkraut. It was a poor, confused sandwich.

To top it off, literally, it was between marble rye bread, a.k.a indecisive rye. Pick a side and do it well. Lacking in caraway and soft to the touch, it came apart quite easily when pulling at the rubbery corned beef. I'm not talking "this is a little tough" rubbery, but "don't bite down too quick lest your chin bounce back and sprain your jaw." They could have at least toasted or seared the bread (like one should) to help maintain the structural integrity of the Reuben, but alas, that did not seem to be the case.

So mark me disappointed. On the plus side, I am not a big fan of coleslaw, but I didn't mind eating theirs. It was tangy and sweet. For all I know, the rest of their sandwiches might be decent, average fare. Personally, I will continue my quest for a good Reuben sandwich in the Financial District, or give up and just make and bring my own. Wouldn't be as "fresh," but would be better than those found at the Manhattan Hub.
author: Higgins D.

description: If you are from the East Coast you will be insulted by what they call cheesesteaks and NY pastrami sandwiches. If you are not, this place might be alright. The meats are rather plain, taste like something you would buy at a Safeway, not a NY deli. The sizes are rather generous, and some with all the toppings you would hope for, but the prices are also a couple bucks higher for what you would pay for a normal deli sandwich. In the end, if you enjoy rather plain sandwiches (yes, chicken club fans, that's you) then you will like this place. If you want something more for lunch, definitely skip it.
author: Sam T.

description:
My friend took me here for lunch today.  I had a great hot pastrami, mustard, swiss on rye!  He had ... [what did he have?] ... I can't remember, and we split a Chicken Caesar.  We didn't order the salad with meat; but it came that way.  Dumb girl.

I enjoyed the inside of this space; he wanted to sit outside in the sun (thank GAWD there were no tables to be had).

Anyhow, two good sized sandwiches, two bottled teas and a large salad, after tax: $23.

Not a terrible deal in the FiDi.  Not a stellar place to dine, but a good place to grab lunch on a Monday while you're talkin' shop.
author: Michael O.

description:
I was walking around for lunch and I needed to find something new.  I guess I was in the mood for something not Asian, so I decided to try this place out.

I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and some fries.  The pulled pork was okay, just a little too much on the sauce though.  It was surprisingly not busy for a Monday, so I guess I feel fortunate.  I'd probably give it another try if I'm in that non-Asian groove.
author: Ren L.

description:
I had lunch here today. Manhattan Hub is located in a little alley right off Sacramento and Sansome. The sunshine and all that is great, but the fucking birds and the winds will really come after you. Knocked off my plate of onion rings. The food is so-so, and it mostly gets crowded here around lunch time as there are no other decent places  nearby to get a philly cheesesteak. So, no opportunity cost - go figure.

If you work in the FiDi, go here for lunch once a month. Anymore than that, you'll curse at yourself.
author: Sav B.

description:
I hate getting sucky sandwiches, and the last philly cheese steak I got was from I.B. Hoagies (BIG mistake- I.B. severely disappointed) beacuse I didn't want to go all the way down to The Cheese Steak Shop on University, oh yea and they were closed too.

So there I was, in FiDi for a certification class and my big bro JT who works in the area meets my coworker and I for lunch. JT always asks me where/what I wanna eat, even though he knows I don't know what's around there. I doubt there's decent sushi near by, and I don't think he wants to plunk down for some Unicorn so I just blurt out, "SANDWICHES!?!"

He mentions a spot down the street with Philly Cheese steaks and In my head, my body screams, "NO YOU FAT LARD ASS!!!  Have a turkey sandwich and get thee to a gym! "but my mouf says "It has already been decided."

I feared getting another 'poser' philly cheese steak with tough and chewy bread, lettuce (WTF? lettuce doesn't belong here!), tomatoes (See previous comment) and mustard. 

My fears were allayed this time. No one had to die. Manhattan Hub served a pretty decent Philly Cheese steak for the FiDi crowd. It's no Cheesesteak Shop but hey, for a place that serves so many other things, they can at least get this one right. Salty, melty cheesy, juicy drippy greasy, meaty steaky yum yum (did I REALLY just write that? shoot me now; it sounds like a Jack in the Box commercial).  

I had to take half a star off ,bringing it to 3 stars, because my coworker ordered a chicken pesto wrap thingy, and there was no pesto to be found. Eeeeeh?

Fries were fresh, hot and crisp.
author: Mortiche W.

description:
I come here for one thing only, the Philly Cheesesteak.  It's actually a lot better than any of the cheesesteaks I've had in Philly.  I can't comment on anything else they offer.


*update 4/10/2007*

So I was wanering around not knowing what I wanted for lunch today and ended up letting my feet bring me here.  I wasn't in the mood for a philly cheesesteak though but after taking a peek at their salad display I opted for the 3 salad special for $7.50.  I got a pesto pasta salad, prosciutto pasta salad, and a fresh mozarella/baby spinach/tomato salad.

I dug into the fresh mozarella/spinach/tomato salad first and was very happy with the freshness and flavor.  The spinach was crisp and the mozarella had a firm but moist texture.  The slivers of red onion were a really nice touch too.

The pesto pasta salad of course has pesto and pasta in it.  Also in the mix are broccoli, carrot shavings, black olives, and I believe some shredded parmesan cheese.  This is a great spring salad that has a nice cool feel in your mouth.  I'm a big fan of the carrots and olives so having them in there is wonderful.

The prosciutto pasta salad has peas in it, which I also love.  This salad has a bit of a spicy bite to it.  The prosciutto was on the road to drying out but you really can't have that sitting out for very long before that happens.  The flavor was still good.  The slight saltiness of the prosciutto, the crisp mellow flavor of the peas, and the spicy kick all work really well.

You really get a generous portion of each salad too.  In fact I'm putting away the remaining portion of the pasta salads to eat later.  I'm glad I have a reason other than the Philly Cheesesteaks to come here now.

*update 6/27/2007

Best onion rings in SF!!!  Serious.
author: Luis M.

description:
Wandered into Manhattan Hub for lunch today because the Reuben sandwich had its own category on the menu at a reasonable cost (about $7). I love a good, toasted, juicy Reuben sandwich with lots of corned beef, saurkraut (sp?), and toasted rye bread with some cheese and sauce to boot.

Unfortunately, the sandwich wasn't anywhere close to my daydream while I waited for the sandwich to be prepared. The corned beef was actually crisp from over-grilling - what the heck?  Not much corned beef there to start with, but to crisp the meat on the grill made it worse (so much for the juicy sandwich experience).  The kraut was awfully dry too frankly. The sandwich gets a D in my A through F gradebook.

A sour pickle and some cole slaw were served with the sandwich.  These items were decent.

I loved the space - maybe I just got the wrong sandwich.  Oh well.. there are far too many juicy reuben sandwiches out there to mess with this place again.  My philosophy is this - if the reuben sandwich deserves its own heading in the menu separate from the other sandwiches, it had better be worth it.  In this case, I think a Denny's restaurant would've done a  better job.
author: Jamie W.

description:
This place will always be my frequent lunch spot.  Almost everything on their menu is good.  My recommendations?  Their chicken caesar wrap, their 3 salad plate or caesar salad with grilled salmon.  All are delicious.  If you feel like something light, try their 1/2 sandwich 1/2 pasta option.  The 1/2 sandwich is so big it practically seems like a whole.  You definitely get your moneys worth, imo.

Great place for lunch, plenty of seating, reasonable prices, and the people who work here are pretty friendly.
author: Juv C.
