description: I really like this place! Especially when i'm in the mood for a good sandwich! =) I recently went and was in the mood for a club sandwich, which are my favorite, well it definitely did not disappoint. It was so good, i will definitely go back... yummm!
author: Patricia B.

description:
This place is just okay. On the recommendation of others I had the french dip, and it was uninspiring. I got a lot of food so it was filling, and it is a better bang for your buck compared to other places in the hood. But nothing is calling me back there... 

Salads are better but seem the same as everywhere else 

I'd still rather go to seller's market....
author: Jess O.

description: Giving the corned beef reuben 5 stars. Huge sandwich with lots of corned beef that was delicious and not fatty at all. Served with coleslaw and a pickle. Enough for 2 meals!
author: Emily M.

description:
Came here for lunch today.  I always get the three salad special where you get to pick three salads for $7.25.  Slice of bread is optional.  The portions are humongous.  Every once in a while they have a new salad, but here the usual offerings:

Chicken Caesar
Pesto Pasta
Curry Apple Chicken
Cheese Tortellini
Chicken Tarragon
Tomato Avocado
Tomato Basil Mozzarella
Fruit medley

Sometimes I feel the salads are over-dressed and taste too mayonnaise-ey.  They are on the heavy side, but very filling.  I like sitting at the tables out in the alley on a nice day.
author: Karen K.

description:
Went here for lunch yesterday with a group of people.  Half the people went to Bistro Burger next door.  My friend and I went to grab a sandwich and it took forever for my friend to get his steak sandwich.  The rest of us were basically done with with our meal by the time they brought it out.  

Also, the staff wasn't rude but they weren't very friendly either.  They seemed kind of pissed off for some reason.  

Anyways the turkey/swiss sandwich I had was good, but with so many options downtown, I don't see myself returning anytime soon.
author: Tom K.

description:
Here is the deal.


Atmosphere:
It's a lunch spot. It does have a nice seating area outside amongst the towers of San Francisco. However, given it's location, it's a lunch spot for all the suits who work in the surrounding buildings. 

Service:
Fast.

Price:
For it being downtown and catered to business people on lunch, the price is very reasonable. You can get a good Philly cheese steak for $6.75. Beware- it's served with bell peppers rather than pepperchinis.  

Suggestions:
Don't go out of your way to come here- but it is a good option if you are in the area and need a quick bite of something wholesome.
author: Aaron A.

description: They have your basic work day food.  Nothing on their menu stands out as my favorite.  But, nothing has ever made me sick, so that's why I come back. Sometimes it can get hectic around the pick up area while you're waiting for your food.  You need to pay attention to make sure someone else doesn't grab your food!
author: Nikki c.

description:
Having a website with a menu and being close to the office is an automatic two stars in my book, the rest is just rudimentary. 

My boss actually ended doing the lunch run today and brought it back, so that certainly left a nice impression in my book as well.  

For under $7 I got a french dip sandwich which was quite sizeable, along with a side of fries..or as the foreign invaders call them, chips.   Not a bad deal at all.

Sadly thoug hthat's where the fun stopped.  The sandwich was bland, fries were okay--however it did fill me up well enough to keep up with that night's foreign invasion at the Edinburgh Castle.  

I'll go back if I'm lazy and don't want to walk very far for a meal, or, given others' reviews on the other dishes, I might try something else.
author: Tien N.

description: Solid corner deli for a morning bagel or cheap lunch.  The food is a tad reminiscent of office cafeteria food (albeit good cafeteria food), but affordable and quick.  They have a variety of cold veggie, grain, and fruit salads, falafel (which was pretty gross), sandwiches, and some hot items.
author: Jen R.

description:
This place is okay at first... and when I say that I mean its presented well. You walk in everything is clean and there are a ton of different options in the glass salad/side display case.

I am personally confused by places that sell "gyros" and then serve you something that is not a gyro at all but some rendition of one. This irritates me. A gyro does not come in a pita pocket. It comes on a certain bread...and is served as a wrap. Should have tahini sauce....just like it said on the board.... NOT hummus.  Clearly this place understands that 1. a Gyro is a wrap type food since its listed under the wraps section of the menu.
2. That Gyro's are supposed to have Tahini sauce on them also listed on the menu.

Why then would you serve me a pita pocket wierdo salad/sandwich type thing thrown together and topped with hummus? Maybe the kitchen ran out of ingredents? Maybe someone was lazy...clearly the guy taking my order had smoked one to many bowls the day I was in there he couldnt even manage to take my order without asking three different people to help out.

I like sitting outside. So two stars for the outdoor alleyway seating, this is really the only reason I would go back. Ive never tried the morning breakfast options....and I could prolly get a better Sandwich.  ehhhhh not so much on this one!
author: Charlie B.

description:
After stumbling in here in defiance of Matt H.'s  desire to go to Bistro Burger yet again, I found something truly delicious. I had the Veggie Hub with all of it's avocado-y goodness. Somehow, I always end up with just bread in my hand as all the contents of these sandwiches get eaten before the bread. The first time this happened by accident, but after that, mostly on purpose to avoid all that thick foccacia. Don't get me wrong, it is delicious, but SO much food. You will not leave here hungry.

I'd recommend getting this to go on a nice day and finding some nice sunny spot to eat. But then again, I'm sure you have your favorite FiDi places to eat anyway.
author: Allyson S.

description: Mayonnaise is never tasty....much less slathered on pasta salad.  Also, why must your chicken pesto wrap be so dry?
author: Kerry D.

description: I bought a SFGate Daily Deal for this place.  Picked up their Chinese Chicken Salad, a bowl of soup, and a serving of grilled veggies.  I liked the Chinese Chicken salad, soup was ok, and the grilled veggies were cold (from the fridge).  Some of their other salads looked good...so I'll have to go back and try them out.
author: B C.

description: As a full blown restaurant id have given it a three, but for what it is I say it's a 4. Great place for a quick salad or sandwich.  I love eating at the tables in front when the weather is nice. the prices aren't bad for the area. It won't win any culinary awards but the food is definitely good. Try the prosciutto and pasta salad. It's my favorite dish in the place.
author: Blaine B.

description:
Good veggie philly sandwich. Fake cheese, but nice flavors. 

Fries were hit or miss. Mine were cold and soggy, my friend's were hot and crispy. Go figure. We all ordered together, but each sandwich came out about 3 minutes apart. 

Go eat on the roof of the building on Sansome and Sac or in the alley outside.
author: Elsa E.

description: This place is pretty good and has good portions!  Their prices are very fair and service is great and fast.  If this place were in a better location, I'm sure the wait would be out the door, but being in an alley like street, I'm surprised it still gets quite a crowd.
author: Joseph C.

description:
I thought this was going to be just another ho-hum financial district eatery, complete with over priced stale bread and about the same selection I can get at Lee's Deli.  To my surprise, the french dip was good and the french fried crispy and fresh, and I have since gone back to have a Philly cheese steak and another Philly hybrid that was quite tasty.  

Now if you are a die hard Cheese steak connoisseur, then I am not saying this needs to be on your must try list.  That said, if you want a tasty lunch for a somewhat reasonable price and am sick of the three other sandwich places you normally eat at, then come here.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
French Dip with Fries

The fries were pretty off the hook.  And they give you a grip load.  Hot, crispy with the soft steamy middle.  The french dip roll was solid - soft, toasted, and fresh.  The meat was a tinge dry and the au jus was very can like - no depth.

But overall, it was decent.  Worth another look.
author: Isaac L.

description: This is one of my favorite places for lunch when I forget to bring mine from home.  I enjoy the salad plate for $8.45,  The food is fresh and the staff great!  The portions allow me to nibble all afternoon.  I highly recommend eating here when the weather is nice because of the outdoor seating.  Great Place!  Great Atmosphere!
author: Salvador T.

description: I went to this place for lunch yesterday with my co-worker because we wanted to try something new. There were many people eating inside the restaurant. My co-worker ordered a falafel and I had three different types of salads. All I can say is that this place is not good. After we were done with our meals, our tummy hurts. The salads I chose were extremely greasy. I had a Caesar salad, jerk chicken, and the prosciutto pasta salad. I won't be recommending this place in the future. They do seem to have okay sandwiches.
author: Ivy T.

description:
I was walking around looking for a place to eat for lunch.  I saw by the corner of my eye a crowd gathering in line.  Mesmerized by the hustle and bustle of the crowd i decided to join in.  

I ordered a sausage breakfast burrito with prosciutto pasta.  Not a big deal as for the food, but very impressed with their selection of choices.  I just wanted something for breakfast because i missed it and something for lunch, pasta.  

Ill come back to try the different things, but nothing that really stood out to give it four stars.
author: Bernardo C.

description:
Good of the few places for a good Financial District lunch.  
Get the Crabcake sandwich.  Expensive but good.
author: Patrick A.

description: Had a cajun chicken sandwich... though the chicken was slightly a bit too pink for me, it was okay.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Call me no fun, but I prefer salad to be more salad, less mayo crap. 3 salad combo at lunch can't be any healthier than a burger from Bistro next door. Now that I mention it, pretty much everything is better from Bistro. The only thing the Hub has on BB is its name...so look for me next door.
author: Courtney B.

description: I am not easy to impress but I have to say this place has high standards and everything I have had there over the past few years has been extra good. My favorites are the Mediteranean plate/salad, wraps, and Ruebens. Med plate/salad: let me just point out a perfect falafel is warm, crunchy outside and light inside before you even mention the flavor. This place serves them that way to me every time. The tabbouli is very right also and the hummus. The Ruebens offer Pastrami from NY or corned beef and everything about it is legit. I don't eat much saturated fat, but when it comes to a proper rueben I go all in.
author: Brett K.

description: So, I'm following Jim S. down an alley (as I often do), and much to my delight, this time I was neither stabbed nor beaten with a bicycle chain. Instead, he treated me to a TGIF lunch! Actually, I've been coming to this place for years and enjoy their decadent menu selections -- crab-cake sammich, anyone? -- and indoor/outdoor seating. But I must admit that everything was yummier with a true New Yorker sitting across the table from me. I challenge you to walk out of here hungry.
author: Gregor G.

description: Try the crab cake sandwich.  It's one of the daily specials (there are only two daily specials actually... and they never change; philly cheese and crab cake).  They give you two crab cake patties on a delicious bun.  Definitely worth your time and money, and far less greasy than the cheese steaks... although I'm not sure if they're any healthier.
author: Daniel L.

description: Foodwise, they are still pretty good, but it is a freakin' ICE BOX in there!  Seriously, you have to keep your coat on and you'll still shiver the entire time inside.  This is a big enough deal that I've pretty much decided to avoid this place until the weather heats up.
author: Steve G.

description: ordered for delivery, service was on time, which is great. people seemed friendly.  most of the sandwiches were good.  pretty fresh.  reuben was very big, lots of meat.  but the expensive crab cake sandwich was imitation crab meal and potatoes?  not worth it.  but other stuff is good.
author: Food Is L.

description: I went here today w/ a couple of my co-workers for lunch.  Ordered the French Dip R.B w/ fries for $7.45.  The sandwich was pretty good, although the roast beef seemed a bit dry.... they were super generous with the fries.  Overall, the meal was pretty decent.  I definitely would need to try some of the other items on the menu before I could give this place a higher star rating.  But from my experience today, it was pretty good, and I would definitely stop by again sometime.  The wait-staff were very nice and helpful.  There were no crazy crowds.  The tables were clean, although a bit on the smaller side, so you'd better  be comfortable w/ being cozy with your other guests.
author: Minh V.

description: Yes, I absolutely LOVE this place. The food is fresh, the meats tender and seasoned, all ingredients are ripe and delicious. I especially love the 3 Salad plate..Great Deal for $7.95.. One of the Financial Dst. Gems!!!
author: Kym G.

description: It's the perfect place to go in the area for a greasy lunch.  A load of sandwich options (cold, hot, wraps, cheesesteaks), salads, and sides (fries, onion rings, cole slaw) are offered.  Their philly veggie was great.  There's seating indoors--the tables inside are pretty cramped--and out in the alleyway.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I'm in charge of ordering the company's weekly breakfast.  I recently added Manhattan Hub to the list and I haven't regretted it.  Their breakfast items are great and their fruit salad is AMAZING!  We've been getting our fruit salad from Specialty's and they mix in only about 3 kinds of fruit.  The fruit salad from Manhattan Hub is much much more plentiful.  Their breakfast croissant sandwich is fantastic....turkey (or ham) with provolone on a toasted croissant.  Mmmmm...gotta love cheesey carbs.
author: Michelle N.

description: A terrific downtown lunch spot. Nice outdoor area. Lots of tasty menu items, including an awesome Rueben, and surprising cheap prices. You can also order online to have your food ready when you get there.
author: Ed M.

description: Manhattan Hub is a great place to eat!  Their Philly cheese steaks are yummy and I've recently fallen in love with the Chinese chicken salad with fresh mango dressing.  Another favorite of mine is that this is the only place that I tend to run into one of my old friends from college since he works up the street from there.  Hmm, I wonder.  Should I head there tomorrow?
author: Melanie B.

description: I just stumbled upon this place yesterday. I was impressed with the large selection. I had the spinich salad...which I always get and I think I can safely say it is the best one of the FiDi lunch spots thus far. A hearty portion and great vinigarette. I am excited to go back and try more. Not the most friendly service, but pretty quick and decently priced.
author: Lisa K.

description:
you can get *breakfast for lunch*.  that's automatically good in my book!  and it's actually pretty good.  their other food is good too!

they are busy!  a lot of people go for the lunch time rush hour.  and the dining room is nice enough to stay there and eat.   i think i learned a new dance while waiting for my order. step left, spin right, turn around look for an opening, and step back.

**UPDATE**
today sucked, man. they don't do breakfast all day anymore, so i couldn't get my breakfast burrito.  so i asked for the fresh mozzarella sandwich, and they said they were out.  out of what? i see all the ingredients around.  i got the eggplant sandwich.  the cold one.  it was so nasty.  and it had fresh mozzarella in it!  so i guess that had they  *had* the other sandwich, it would have sucked too.
and they're pretty expensive too.  blecht.
author: Monk R.

description:
the tuna melt was great.  for just a hair over $8, you get a large tuna melt, with a large order of fries.  and to add to that, the fries are pretty good.

it's a good place to come for lunch downtown, as a plus you can sit outside.
author: Jason J.

description: Manhattan Hub may be well known for its sandwiches and salads but let me tell you, do not order the fish and chips.   It is not worth the price.  The fillets were all shaped the same so you know it was mass produced and on  top of that the fillets were old.   Let me put it another way, the fish and chips I ordered today was very disappointing.  And I know fish and chips.  Should have gone to Mickey D's instead.
author: Eatalot Y.

description:
Manhattan Hub is one of my favorite places to eat lunch in the financial district.  I especially like to order lunch combos that come with fries (double patty crab cakes, pulled pork sandwich, french dip (but add cheese)) because they always serve more food than I can possibly eat.  The fries are always deep fried to perfection (not too greasy and just enough crisp).

I'm not a huge fan of the three salad plate, but half of the people who come here seem to order it in an attempt to be healthy.  Maybe they're forgetting this is a New York deli.

A word of warning...never order the ultimate grilled cheese sandwich unless you enjoy eating inch-thick globs of lukewarm mozzarella stuffed in between two slices of bread.

On a warm sunny day, it's best to enjoy the outdoor seating and a bit of shade from the pyramid.

So overall, love this place and you should walk down the alley and check it out.
author: Krystle C.

description: The Philly Cheesesteak is decent here, so if you're expecting a greasy, juicy sandwich like the ones you see from Pat's King of Steaks in Philly - keep your expectations at a minimum.   The hoagie roll was soft, the chopped beef resembled carne asada (unlike the real deal that uses rib-eye steak) and the meat was dry and not juicy.  They do offer free sweet or spicy peppers as a side.  Alternating bites of sandwich and pepper really is a great way to eat this.  This place falls under the same echelon as IB Hoagies and a step above the Cheesesteak Shop
author: B W.

description: good cheesesteaks
author: Michael E.

description: I had the veggie sandwich here. It should suffice to say that I won't come back here
author: saurabh S.

description: The worst Cheesesteak sandwich i have ever had. very plain and flavorless meat and low quality bread Used the daily deal from living social so it only cost me 4.35 but I will not be coming back to pay $7+ for the sandwich. Huge menu (too big in my opinion) and the only thing I have tried here so I take that into consideration and props for at least offering the living social deal.
author: damien c.

description: If you like pasta and salads this is a good lunch deal. You can choose any three for like 7.95 they also have great grilled shrimp salad that's prepared right in front of you. There's limited seating inside and outside so come early if you're looking for a seat.
author: Olga P.

description: Not a bad place for Breakfast or Lunch. I love the fact that they're an Illy retailer and they do make a good latte and Cappuccino. Their Breakfast Sandwiches and Burritos are very good but, their deli sandwiches and burgers are just average.  You do get your money's worth at this place and generally great service.
author: Marco M.

description: This place is a good sandwich place. If you want a decent sandwich for a decent price MH delivers. I don't like all the sandwiches but at the end of the day, it's just a sandwich and the freshness makes up for any personal issues the sandwich may have caused. my personal favorite is the oven roasted turkey, it's really fresh, comes with a ton of meat and a pickle. With the prices you find around the same area, it's a hard lunch to beat. I recommend the easy and fast online ordering they have provided on their website. you just order and either pay online or when you pick up.
author: nina B.

description: Great selection of fresh food here: sandwiches (hot or cold), wraps, burgers, phillies, veggies, fries, etc. Not so great selection of drinks: Snapple, Vitamin Water, etc. Everything I've had here has been pretty solid and I haven't been disappointed yet. The rueben is tasty. The falafels are adequate and crunchy. The hot sandwiches are just right. I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I can.
author: LM M.

description: Not sure why I chose to get a salad at this grill, but the Mediterranean Hub salad was good. I will come back and next time I'll try one of their grilled chicken sandwiches (as the chicken in my salad was tasty).  The salad was big at a reasonable price ($8-$9).
author: J S.

description:
portions are a little small for the prices, especially lately.
3 salad combo seems like the way to go for 7.75
author: Christian W.

description: My order took very long my first time there. I also ordered the wrong thing. NEVER get the 'crab-cake' sandwich special. It's double deep fried and dry!
author: Jj H.

description: Breakfast burritos are tasty, the salads are fresh and fairly inexpensive. I love Illy coffee so I am a fan of this place for breakfast and it is never that crowded until lunch time. I have not tried the Ruben and cheese steak but hear they are delicious.  Ohh and pretty darn good hummus but has a lot of garlic.
author: michael h.

description: Great lunch place!  Good sandwich and salad options... reasonable price too (around $7-8)... I love the avacado and tomato salad and the prosciutto pasta. yummy.
author: grant l.

description: Since when is +$7 for lunch cheap??? I gues syou FiDi people make a lot more then me.  Anyways, I couldn't give this place anthing less then 4 stars.  Their pastrami rueben I had was the best sandwich I have had in years.  The fries were pretty standard, but that rueben, oh that rueben.
author: Daniel M.

description: Great quality food for how fast it was.  Friendly staff, but not much of a eat-in place.  Seemingly quite popular with the locals.  I didn't have anything too complicated, just a mozzarella and tomato sandwich, but even that had a special dressing above and beyond balsamic vinegar.
author: Ariana N.

description:
Was lured by the Illy, but they should learn how to acutally make espresso.  I was served a double espresso, that I requested to be short, in a cappucino mug half filled.  

I could spend a lot of money at the butcher's but that does not mean I cook a good steak.  Why bother with the Illy if they don't make the most of it?
author: Dan G.

description: Great place for lunch when you are having a busy day.  Good food, great attitude and service.  Be sure to tip.
author: Barbara S.

description:
WOW!! THIS PLACE IS OUT OF THIS WORLDD!!! wondering around FIDI stumbbled upon Manhattan Hub and the line was long but the service was quick! I Tried the Philly Cheese Steak and I can with out a doubt say that it was the best Philly Steak EVER!! (Philly, side and drink for $9.60 what a dealll??!) Onion Rings were great as well and you can also get frings ( Onion Rings AND Fries) for a really good price!! The Salads looked appetizing, but Im going to wait to try it next time. There are so many items to choose from!!
Definately adding this one to my restaurant favorites list.
author: Manalya J.

description: even though it's rather basic, this is more of a place to go with a co-worker or friend rather than a pick up and bring back to the office kind of place.  or maybe that's just for me.  anyway, their crab cake sandwich will suffice until i find a better real lump crab cake sandwich in the area.  the ultimate grilled cheese is decent too.  and they used to make a fierce peanut butter and banana breakfast sandwich, but i guess i was the only one ordering it because it has disappeared from the menu.
author: spiff e.

description: A one-stop shop if you ask me.  For lunch come here to get their 3 salad combo for $7.  You can choose any of their salads: pasta, fruit, pasta with prosciutto, falafel.....soo many to choose from.  Every now and then I get cravings for Philly Cheese steak sandwiches.  sooo good!!!  I've even stopped by in the morning for a breakfast sandwich.  How can I say no to good food?
author: Mary H.

description: I have yet to try actual food at this location, but alls i know is that they have very flavorful hot tea with real honey (in the bear!), delicious toasted bagels for only 1.10 and they always have bhaklava tempting you at the cashier.
author: Rhea A.

description: i went there for a pulled pork sandwich after 10 years' absence.  i thought they had better sandwiches; but i was totally disappointed.
author: Gut O.

description: I like the falafel (although it is no comparison to the Oasis Grill) and I enjoy some of the salad selections (a little big for a lunchtime serving, but I guess portion control is a real personal thing).  The reason this gets a fourth star (since pedestrian food and nondescript interiors usually amount to three) - service.  Quick, efficient, accurate.  All I need when grabbing an oft-rushed lunch during the work day.  One of these days I'll listen to my mom and pack a lunch the night before.  Until then, this is a nice alternative.
author: Anjali K.
